# The `SwingSchedulerDAG` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This class builds the dependence graph for the instructions in a loop, and attempts to schedule the instructions using the SMS algorithm. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>class llvm::SwingSchedulerDAG</CodeBlock>

</MembersIndexItem>

</MembersIndex>

## Description {#details}

This class builds the dependence graph for the instructions in a loop, and attempts to schedule the instructions using the SMS algorithm.

Definition at line 230 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h">MachinePipeliner.h</a>.

### fixupRegisterOverlaps() {#a51bda1806219d879123625c8d4ae3fbc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SwingSchedulerDAG::fixupRegisterOverlaps (std::deque&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &#42; &gt; &amp; Instrs)</>}>
Attempt to fix the degenerate cases when the instruction serialization causes the register lifetimes to overlap.

For example, p&#39; = store&#95;pi(p, b) = load p, offset In this case p and p&#39; overlap, which means that two registers are needed. Instead, this function changes the load to use p&#39; and updates the offset.

### calculateRecMII() {#a0fc2a7bedd4c3e03b5873f83e79355ca}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned SwingSchedulerDAG::calculateRecMII (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">NodeSetType</a> &amp; NodeSets)</>}>
Calculate the recurrence-constrainted minimum initiation interval.

Iterate over each circuit. Compute the delay(c) and distance(c) for each circuit. The II needs to satisfy the inequality delay(c) - II&#42;distance(c) &lt;= 0. For each circuit, choose the smallest II that satisfies the inequality, and the RecMII is the maximum of those values.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h/#l00398">398</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h">MachinePipeliner.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp/#l01567">1567</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp">MachinePipeliner.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### calculateResMII() {#af3bcb5961f7a85fee68461dc6f3adeea}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned SwingSchedulerDAG::calculateResMII ()">
Calculate the resource constrained minimum initiation interval for the specified loop.

We use the DFA to model the resources needed for each instruction, and we ignore dependences. A different DFA is created for each cycle that is required. When adding a new instruction, we attempt to add it to each existing DFA, until a legal space is found. If the instruction cannot be reserved in an existing DFA, we create a new one.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h/#l00397">397</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h">MachinePipeliner.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp/#l01555">1555</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp">MachinePipeliner.cpp</a>.

<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if we can change the instruction to use an offset value from the previous iteration.

### checkNodeSets() {#a2d952a8df443c64f2b71e7b5769f0291}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SwingSchedulerDAG::checkNodeSets (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">NodeSetType</a> &amp; NodeSets)</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/check">Check</a> if the existing node-sets are profitable.

If not, then ignore the recurrent node-sets, and attempt to schedule all nodes together. This is a heuristic. If the MII is large and all the recurrent node-sets are small, then it&#39;s best to try to schedule all instructions together instead of starting with the recurrent node-sets.

### checkValidNodeOrder() {#a8c36a266c74ca556a5967b55824db8eb}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SwingSchedulerDAG::checkValidNodeOrder (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">NodeSetType</a> &amp; Circuits) const</>}>
A property of the node order in swing-modulo-scheduling is that for nodes outside circuits the following holds: none of them is scheduled after both a successor and a predecessor.

The method below checks whether the property is met. If not, debug information is printed and statistics information updated. Note that we do not use an assert statement. The reason is that although an invalid node order may prevent the pipeliner from finding a pipelined schedule for arbitrary II, it does not lead to the generation of incorrect code.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h/#l00410">410</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h">MachinePipeliner.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp/#l03226">3226</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp">MachinePipeliner.cpp</a>.

### computeNodeFunctions() {#a186424dcc81a78c441731a980d4ec7f6}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SwingSchedulerDAG::computeNodeFunctions (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">NodeSetType</a> &amp; NodeSets)</>}>
Compute several functions need to order the nodes for scheduling.

ASAP - Earliest time to schedule a node. ALAP - Latest time to schedule a node. MOV - Mobility function, difference between ALAP and ASAP. D - Depth of each node. H - Height of each node.

### computeNodeOrder() {#a74490ca24a23c6ac48795945cd564438}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SwingSchedulerDAG::computeNodeOrder (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvector">NodeSetType</a> &amp; NodeSets)</>}>
Compute an ordered list of the dependence graph nodes, which indicates the order that the nodes will be scheduled.

This is a two-level algorithm. First, a partial order is created, which consists of a list of sets ordered from highest to lowest priority.

### updatePhiDependences() {#a9109b3fda2093b8cd43b2901ccbe8c71}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void SwingSchedulerDAG::updatePhiDependences ()">
Update the phi dependences to the DAG because <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scheduledaginstrs">ScheduleDAGInstrs</a> no longer processes dependences for PHIs.

This function adds true dependences from a PHI to a use, and a loop carried dependence from the use to the PHI. The loop carried dependence is represented as an anti dependence edge. This function also removes chain dependences between unrelated PHIs.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h/#l00395">395</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/codegen/machinepipeliner-h">MachinePipeliner.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp/#l00932">932</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/machinepipeliner-cpp">MachinePipeliner.cpp</a>.
